orbotix.view.connection
Class SpheroConnectionView

java.lang.Object
  RelativeLayout
      orbotix.view.connection.SpheroConnectionView

public class SpheroConnectionView
extends RelativeLayout

View for discovering and connecting to an already paired Sphero. 


 
        // Get Sphero Connection View from layout file - autostarts discovery (startDiscovery())
        SpheroConnectionView mSpheroConnectionView = (SpheroConnectionView) findViewById(R.id.sphero_connection_view);

        // This event listener will notify you when these events occur, it is up to you what you want to do during them
        mSpheroConnectionView.addConnectionListener(new ConnectionListener() {

            public void onConnected(Robot sphero) {
                mRobot = (Sphero) sphero; // keep a reference
                // Hide the connection view.
                mSpheroConnectionView.setVisibility(View.INVISIBLE);
            }

            public void onConnectionFailed(Robot sphero) {
                // let the SpheroConnectionView handle or hide it and do something here...
            }

            public void onDisconnected(Robot sphero) {
                mSpheroConnectionView.startDiscovery();
            }
        });

setSingleSpheroMode

public void setSingleSpheroMode(boolean isSingleSphero)
Sets whether or not this View will allow only a single Sphero to be connected. If set to true, this View wont allow a user to connect to more than one Sphero. This defaults to true.

Parameters:
isSingleSphero - true, if the user should only connect to one Sphero. Defaults to TRUE.

setOneAtATimeMode

public void setOneAtATimeMode(boolean oneAtATimeMode)
Sets whether or not the user must connect only one Sphero at a time. The user can eventually connect to multiple Spheros, but can only be in the act of connecting to a single Sphero at the same time.

Parameters:
oneAtATimeMode - if true, the user can only be connecting to one at a time.

getConnectedRobots

public java.util.List<Robot> getConnectedRobots()
Gets the list of currently connected robots.

Returns:
a List of Robot.

setNotYetConnectedDrawable

public void setNotYetConnectedDrawable(Drawable notYetConnectedDrawable)
Sets a Drawable to be used on each list item that has not yet connected, and has not failed to connect. This is the default state of each Sphero when the View is started. By default, this is a grey circle.

Parameters:
notYetConnectedDrawable - a Drawable to show

setConnectionFailedDrawable

public void setConnectionFailedDrawable(Drawable connectionFailedDrawable)
Sets a Drawable to be used next to each Sphero in the list that has failed to connect.

Parameters:
connectionFailedDrawable - a Drawable to show when a Sphero fails to connect. By default, this is a red 'x'.

setConnectedSuccessDrawable

public void setConnectedSuccessDrawable(Drawable connectedSuccessDrawable)
Sets a Drawable to be displayed next to each Sphero in the list that has successfully connected.

Parameters:
connectedSuccessDrawable - a Drawable to show. By default, this is a green checkmark.
